document.docAuthor: Golovatch, Sergei I., Geoffroy, Jean-Jacques, Mauriès, Jean-Paul & Spiegel, Didier Van Den
document.docTitle: Glyphiulus mediobliteratus Golovatch & Geoffroy & Mauriès & Spiegel 2007, n. sp.
document.masterDocTitle: Review of the millipede genus Glyphiulus Gervais, 1847, with descriptions of new species from Southeast Asia (Diplopoda, Spirostreptida, Cambalopsidae). Part 2: the javanicus-group

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the millipede genus Glyphiulus Gervais, 1847, with descriptions of new species from Southeast Asia (Diplopoda, Spirostreptida, Cambalopsidae). Part 2: the javanicus-group

caption.paragraph:
FIG. 7. —
Glyphiulus mediobliteratus
n. sp. ,paratype ♂: A , midbody segment section; B , both gonopods in situ , frontal view; C , anterior gonopod, frontal view; D , anterior gonopod, caudal view; E , posterior gonopod, subfrontal view; F , claw. Scale bars: A, 0.5 mm; B-D, 0.1 mm; E, F, 0.05 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: ETYMOLOGY. — To emphasize the strongly obliterated collum and axial crests.

DIAGNOSIS. — Differs from congeners by the unpigmented ocelli and, in part, body, coupled with the nearly smooth collum, the rudimentary axial crests, the lack of a notch on each anterior gonopod half, the highly conspicuous, slightly plumose flagellum of the posterior gonopod, etc. (see also key below).

paragraph.materialsCitation: Holotype with 61p+1a+ T , about 43 mm long and 2.0 mm wide; adult paratypes ( ♂ , ♀ ) with 51-62p+2- 1a+ T , length 32-42 mm , width 1.8-2.0 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Coloration entirely pallid to pale brown, only tips of tubercles of tergal crests often brownish to dark brown. Ocelli not visible.
Anterior gonopods ( Figs 7 B-D; 8G) without notches, processes (d) especially high. Posterior gonopods ( Figs 7E ; 8H ) with characteristic, long, distally plumose flagella.
The presence of completely unpigmented ocelli suggests that this species may be troglobitic, but further observations are needed to confirm this.
